snippet: Inconsistencies in airport security in Egypt are now under a spotlight as evidence from the crash of a Russian charter jet points to the possibility of a bombing.
abstract: Security systems at Egyptian airports are under increased scrutiny following crash of Russian charter jet that departed from Egypt; details in crash point to possibility of bombing, leaving investigators to ponder how bomb would have been smuggled aboard.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM, DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and NICOLA CLARK
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Sharm el Sheikh, David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo, and Nicola Clark from Paris. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, and Stephen Castle and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London.

lead_paragraph: Inconsistencies in airport security in Egypt are now under a spotlight as evidence from the crash of a Russian charter jet points to the possibility of a bombing.

headline.main: Gaps in Egyptian Airport Security Face Scrutiny After Crash
headline.print_headline: Gaps in Egypt Airport Security Face Scrutiny
